Entries.Mon4: When berry season arrives, there's more than enough food to go around.#$e#You just have to know how to look for them, and they come in abundance.
Entries.Mon6: There's nothing like the feeling of making it through another winter with just the gifts of the mountain.$h
Entries.Mon8: Me? Married? Haha, no, I've never been married.$h#$e#I've never demanded that anyone else should conform to my lifestyle.
Entries.Tue2: Is there something that you want?
Entries.Tue6: A long time ago, yes, I grew up in a family. I haven't seen them for many years.#$e#I don't think I can even remember their faces anymore...$s
Entries.Tue10: Well, @, I suppose I could consider you a part of my new family, if that's alright.$h#$e#Oh, please don't be alarmed. The trees, the rocks, the lake, the sky... they are all my family, too.
Entries.Wed4: This land will continue to exist for many eons past our lifetimes.#$b#Please do treat it with respect.
Entries.Thu: ...Hmm? Do you want something from me?
Entries.Thu2: ...Maybe I need to pack up my tent and move again.$s
Entries.Thu6: Yes, you saw me taking food from the trash cans that one time...$s#$e#Usually, I just live on the food that nature provides, but the food that others throw out goes to complete waste if I don't take it.$s#$e#Is that any way to treat the world that provides for us?
Entries.Thu8: Sometimes, people don't understand me, but that doesn't make them bad.#$e#It just bothers me when they show hostility.
Entries.Thu10: There is a beauty in caring for others.#$b#So if I find something delicious and there's enough for two, I'll leave it in your mailbox.$h
Entries.Fri: Please don't destroy my tent.#$e#It's happened before.$s
Entries.Fri2: Why do you keep visiting me?
Entries.Fri8: Where do we go after we die? I suppose I'll go into the ground.#$e#Just back into the flow of nature, is all.#$e#It doesn't have to be so bad, if you think about it.#$e#I guess I'm not quite ready for that yet, though.$h
Entries.Sat: I'm happy by myself, you know.#$e#I don't need new friends.
Entries.Sat6: I don't imagine I'll stay here much longer.#$e#Don't be alarmed if you come up here and my tent is suddenly gone.#$e#That's how I've always done it.
Entries.Sat8: Perhaps I'll stay here another year.#$e#I don't normally stay put in one place for this long, but...$s
Entries.Sat10: At this rate, I may just stay here indefinitely.$h#$e#I can live in nature as much as I want, but I'm not too far away from at least one good neighbor. Thank you, @.
Entries.Sun2: You don't have to speak to me if you don't want to.
Entries.Sun8: When I first met you, @, I was sure I would be leaving the valley soon. Thank you for helping to change my mind.
Entries.summer_Tue8: Marlon and Gil? Yes, I see them every now and then.#$e#We mostly keep to ourselves.
Entries.summer_Sun6: I once caught a bass in the lake that was longer than my arm.$h#$e#That was a long time ago. I don't know that I'll ever break that record.
Entries.fall_Mon8: I'll admit, I've followed you into the mines before, from a distance.#$e#I'm sorry. I just want to make sure you stay safe...
Entries.fall_Tue10: Hi there, @!$h#$e#Find any good foraging spots today?
Entries.fall_Wed8: The mountain owes us nothing, yet it still gives. Anything we take is an undeserved gift. We must never forget to be thankful.
Entries.fall_Sun10: Have you tried fishing with wild bait yet?
Entries.winter_Mon6: I could hide indefinitely from the cold in the hot spring, but that isn't where I live.#$e#I'd rather not step on anyone's toes. The building belongs to the village.
Entries.winter_Tue8: If I play things right, I can go for a week or so without food.#$e#It isn't my first choice, but I can do it if it becomes necessary.
Entries.winter_Wed8: Rasmodius is a good friend. We only run into each other every now and then, but we always pick up where we left off.
Entries.winter_Thu8: The family in that house seemed annoyed by my presence when I first settled here. Lately, though, they seem fine with me.
Entries.winter_Sun8: It's important to know that we don't really matter. The world will carry on whether we humans exist or not.
Entries.spring_1_2: Breathe in that spring air!$h#$b#The valley is coming to life.$h
Entries.summer_10: I think I might take a risk tomorrow at the luau and share a little of my cooking.
Entries.winter_15: I caught a glimpse of the ships docking at the beach, from my view up on the mountain.#$e#Maybe I'll give them a look up close.
